abstract: Timothy Egan Op-Ed column suggests that popularity of Donald Trump among Republican voters is due to the proliferation of people who say outlandish things in party's media wing; laments that Trump has pushed other Republican presidential contenders to act like fools in order to gain attention, casting shadow over serious contenders like Ohio Gov John Kasich.
lead_paragraph: Republicans say he’s trashing the brand. But he is the brand, to a degree, a byproduct of all the toxic elements they’ve been throwing into their brew.

headline.main: Trump Is the Poison His Party Concocted
headline.print_headline: Trump Is the Poison His Party Concocted

snippet: Republicans say he’s trashing the brand. But he is the brand, to a degree, a byproduct of all the toxic elements they’ve been throwing into their brew.
